items.q: During which process does a cell copy its entire DNA?
items.explanation: DNA replication occurs before a cell divides so each new cell has a copy.

items.q: Most of the digestion of food occurs in the stomach.
items.explanation: While the stomach churns and chemically attacks food, most digestion and absorption occurs in the small intestine.

items.q: Xylem and phloem are transport tissues found only in animals.
items.explanation: They are the vascular tissues in plants.

items.q: What immune system cells are directly targeted by the HIV virus?
items.explanation: Depletion of these cells leads to AIDS.

items.q: What connects the fetus to the mother's placenta?
items.explanation: It supplies nutrients and oxygen, and removes waste.

items.q: What is the biological term for the shedding of an exoskeleton to grow?
items.explanation: Many insects and crustaceans must do this.

items.q: What essential dietary component is categorized into fat-soluble (A, D, E, K) and water-soluble (C, B-complex) groups?
Which organ contains the vocal cords?
items.explanation: It sits at the top of the trachea.

items.q: What is it called when water evaporates from the leaves of a plant?
items.explanation: This pull helps draw water up from the roots.

items.q: What is the name for the period when a female stops releasing eggs entirely?
items.explanation: It marks the end of a woman's reproductive years.
